solution_line_template: The first trip will use {first_trip_km}*{fuel_per_km}=<<{first_trip_km}*{fuel_per_km}={first_trip_fuel}>>{first_trip_fuel} liters of fuel.
The second trip will use {second_trip_km}*{fuel_per_km}=<<{second_trip_km}*{fuel_per_km}={second_trip_fuel}>>{second_trip_fuel} liters of fuel.
The total liters of fuel are {first_trip_fuel}+{second_trip_fuel}=<<{first_trip_fuel}+{second_trip_fuel}={total_fuel}>>{total_fuel} liters.
